bibl.title: Ben cao gang mu dictionary Vol1

sense.def: ① Illness Sign of tightening and hardening, and of difficulties to bend and stretch in general. Tai ping hui min he ji Recipe book. Northern Song, ju fang 1107~1110. 太平惠民和劑局方 5: 腰胯沉重，百節酸疼，項筋緊急 , “The lower back feels heavy. All the joints ache. The sinews of the nape are tight ”.

②Refers to the violent nature of an illness or to a violent effect of a medication. Ben cao gang mu 本草綱目 Substance Entry chanchu 蟾蜍：每用一錠，井華水服。如瘡勢緊急，五七 錠 , “Each application 1 tablet. Ingest with well effulgence water (PUU: clear water drawn from a well in the early morning hours). In the case of violent sores take five to seven tablets”. Jin ji 筋急 , sinew tension [32]

Illness Sign of a difficulty to stretch the sinews, accompanied by uncomfortable contraction. Su wen 素問 10: 多食辛，則筋急而爪枯 , “If one consumes large quantities of acrid [food], the sinews become tense and the nails dry”.
